1.Name: netCoreSdkVersion
1.Description: Set the .net core SDK version to use, when multiple are installed in the system where the driver is running. Leave empty to ignore this setting.
1.Label: .Net Core SDK Version

2.Name: transportProtocol
2.Description: Protocol used to communicate with the endpoints
2.Label: Transport Protocol

5.Name: driverAddress
5.Description: Driver CFX Message Source. Internal queue for sending messages.
5.Label: Driver Address

6.Name: driverUsername
6.Description: Username to use for authentication. Use with amqps.
6.Label: Driver Username

7.Name: driverPassword
7.Description: Password to use for authentication. Use with amqps.
7.Label: Driver Password

8.Name: brokerEndPoint
8.Description: Broker EndPoint that we are going to use to connect to.
8.Label: Broker EndPoint

9.Name: brokerExchange
9.Description: The Broker exchange we are going to be publish to.
9.Label: Broker Exchange

10.Name: brokerQueue
10.Description: The Broker queue to be used to subscribe messages.
10.Label: Broker Queue

11.Name: brokerUsername
11.Description: Username to use for authentication. Use with amqps.
11.Label: Broker Username

12.Name: brokerPassword
12.Description: Password to use for authentication. Use with amqps.
12.Label: Broker Password

13.Name: targetHandle
13.Description: Target CFX Handle (e.g. <maker>.<model>.<serial>), machine CFX Handle that we are going to communicate with.
13.Label: Target Handle

14.Name: targetEndPoint
14.Description: Target CFX EndPoint (e.g. amqp://127.0.0.1:5672/), machine CFX EndPoint that we are going to communicate with.
14.Label: Target EndPoint

15.Name: targetAddress
15.Description: Target Address (i.e. /queue/machine), machine CFX Address that we are going to communicate with.
15.Label: Target Address

16.Name: targetUsername
16.Description: Username to use for authentication. Use with amqps.
16.Label: Username

17.Name: targetPassword
17.Description: Password to use for authentication. Use with amqps.
17.Label: Password

18.Name: certificatesRootFolder
18.Description: Absolute path of the root folder for the Public Key Infrastructure. Allows the use of tokens ${temp} or ${tmp} for the OS temporary folder and token ${id} for replacing with the respective driver instance id
18.Label: Certificates Root Folder

19.Name: certificate
19.Description: Own certificate - can be either a path to a file or the contents of the file in plain text. Format should be 'pem'
19.Label: Certificate

20.Name: privateKey
20.Description: Own private key - can be either a path to a file or the contents of the file in plain text. Format should be 'pem'
20.Label: Private Key

21.Name: connectionReconnectInterval
21.Description: The time interval between attempts to reconnect publish or subscriber channels after a network interruption, in seconds.
21.Label: Connection Reconnect Interval

22.Name: connectionRequestTimeout
22.Description: When executing a point to point request/response call to another CFX endpoint, this time span specifies the maximum amount of time that this endpoint will wait for the other endpoint to respond before timing out, in seconds.
22.Label: Connection Request Timeout

23.Name: useLowLevelLogging
23.Description: Whether or not to use low level logging
23.Label: Use Low Level Logging

24.Name: eventsExpiration
24.Description: Time in seconds before an event is considered expired.
24.Label: Events Expiration

25.Name: onRequestReceivedTimeoutReply
25.Description: Internal time to wait for a reply to an external request, by the controller
25.Label: On Request Received Timeout Reply

26.Name: messagesToIgnore
26.Description: List of messages that are to be ignored and discarded.
26.Label: Messages to Ignore

27.Name: logMessagesFromOtherSources
27.Description: Whether or not to log messages from other sources
27.Label: Log Messages From Other Sources
